entries.title: In the aftermath of Trump’s epic falling out with Musk, staffers within the Department of Government Efficiency face an ironic position after months of paring back jobs and spending: They now fear being DOGE’d
President Trump warned former right-hand-man Elon Musk to stay out of the midterm elections, threatening “very serious consequences” if he backed Democrats in the campaign
Elon Musk and House Republicans both promised to tackle federal spending. It turns out only one of them was serious, and it wasn’t Musk, the WSJ’s Greg Ip writes.
UFO myths gripped America for decades, and the Pentagon finally figured out where a lot of them came from. It was the Pentagon.
Many thought the partnership between Elon Musk and Donald Trump was doomed from the start. They were right.
The Trump administration closed a controversial program that used undercover U.S. air marshals on flights to surveil passengers
Katie Miller, the longtime aide to President Trump and now a top adviser to Elon Musk, is caught in the middle of their spectacular fallout
The Supreme Court cleared the way for DOGE to access sensitive Social Security Administration records
You asked, and @WSJ White House correspondent Natalie Andrews answered questions in real time about the Trump-Musk feud
President Trump is expected to sign an executive order staving off enforcement of a law banning or forcing the sale of TikTok
In an interview, CBO head Phill Swagel defended its forecasting record as Republicans blast the fiscal scorekeeping agency’s assessment of their tax-and-spending megabill
David Hogg has a plan to revitalize the moribund Democratic brand: get rid of some of the party’s oldest lawmakers. More than a few party leaders aren’t pleased.
President Trump and Elon Musk praised each other at a farewell news conference as the billionaire returns to the private sector though Trump said Musk would continue advising him
President Trump is at risk of shrinking the Republican coalition that he broadened to win the 2024 election
Top donors to a committee supporting events celebrating America’s 250th birthday will receive special access to a military parade and other festivities
President Trump’s political team commissioned a poll that showed Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene losing a potential race for Senate in Georgia by double-digits

An inspector general probe into Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s use of the Signal messaging service is focusing on whether details of a military operation were classified and if anyone ordered texts to be deleted
President Trump issued executive orders that ease restrictions on American drones and give local law enforcement more power to take down rogue drones
The Trump administration is redirecting a key antidrone technology earmarked for Ukraine to American forces
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth vowed that there would be “devastating consequences” should China seek to “conquer” Taiwan
Intelligence staffer Nathan Vilas Laatsch charged with seeking to pass classified documents to foreign government
